spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room adjacency broadly matches (left bedroom, central bath, small office, right bedroom, open kitchen/dining, living area), but several layout specifics deviate: living room enclosure/partitioning differs from the plan, several door positions/swings do not align with the 2D arcs, window locations/counts do not match the plan’s exterior openings, and some room sizes appear altered (notably the left bedroom and the central service strip).

structural_fidelity.notes: All major rooms appear present and generally adjacent as in the plan, but the wall layout is not a faithful extrusion of the 2D: the living-room boundary/entry condition is changed, door embeddings appear shifted from the plan’s wall segments, and exterior opening placement is inconsistent. No clearly new/extra rooms were added, but multiple structural elements are relocated/simplified.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not match the 2D plan well: the left bedroom is missing one of the two single beds, several items are substituted (desk types, storage), and living-room/kitchen fixtures are simplified/rearranged relative to the plan. Scales look broadly plausible but do not map tightly to the drawn layout.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean, readable isometric-style render with coherent lighting and generally tidy geometry. Minor issues: not strictly orthographic (noticeable perspective), and some openings/doors feel visually inconsistent with the 2D intent, reducing clarity as a verification render.

detected_errors.description: Living room boundary/partition differs: the 2D plan shows the living room more distinctly enclosed with a defined opening condition, while the 3D uses a different wall/partial-wall configuration, changing circulation.
Door orientation/swing inconsistencies: multiple interior doors (notably along the central corridor/service strip) do not clearly match the 2D door swing directions and hinge sides.
Door placement mismatch: at least one of the doors serving the right-side bedroom/office zone appears shifted relative to the corresponding wall segments in the 2D plan.
Window placement/count mismatch: the 3D exterior windows (left facade and right facade) do not align with the 2D plan’s indicated openings (top strip openings and kitchen-side opening positions).
Room proportion distortion: the left bedroom and central service areas appear resized compared with the 2D plan, contributing to altered furniture fit and circulation widths.
Missing furniture element: the left bedroom in the 2D plan contains two single beds; the 3D render shows only one.
Kitchen fixture layout mismatch: sink/counter/cooktop arrangement in the 3D does not clearly match the 2D plan’s bottom-right kitchen run and appliance placement.
Hallucinated/substituted furniture forms: the office desk geometry (curved corner workstation) and some cabinetry do not correspond to the 2D plan’s furniture depiction.
